circumstances: Shortly after takeoff from Everett-Paine Field Airport, the twin engine airplane encountered difficulties to climb, stalled and crashed. Two passengers were seriously injured while five other occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Stall during initial climb due to inadequate preflight preparation on part of the pilot. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Airframe ice, 
- Improperly loaded aircraft,
- 1,000 lbs over max gross weight, 
- CofG 1,59 inch behind aft limit, 
- Ice and snow on wings and tail prior to takeoff.
